Miroku produced Charles Daly shotguns from 1963 until 1976.

The Model 500 was a straightforward field gun of proven design. It featured an Anson and Deely type boxlock action with a blued receiver, a bit of simple engraving, checkered walnut pistol grip stock and moderate beavertail forend, and blued chopper lump barrels struck full length with a concave (English style) rib. Double underbolts keep the gun closed. A single bead at the end of the rib serves as the sight.

title: For Sale:  Radom VIS 35 Pistol with Original BNZ Code Holster & Ammo
postcontent:
Many say that the Radom VIS 35 was THE BEST sidearm in WWII no matter which side you were on. 

The handgun for sale today is a great example of a Type 2 pistol meaning that most of features of the Type 1 pistols that Radom produced before the war remain. 

A Type 2 pistol retains the original 3 lever design and is made from quality materials with very good workmanship. It differs from a pre-war pistol in that it does not have the shoulder stock slot and it's salt blued instead of the more labor intensive rust blue process used on pre-war models. 

This pistol is in excellent condition retaining at least 90% of it's original salt blued finish. Grips are crisp and clean with no chips or cracks. The bore is in amazing condition with strong rifling and a mirror bright appearance. It's mechanically tight and functions perfectly. The numbers match - frame, slide and barrel. 

My research indicates the pistol was made in the first quarter of 1943. The Waffenamt WaA77 is stamped on both the frame and slide indicating it was produced in Poland while under Nazi occupation. 

Pistol comes with 1 factory original magazine and 1 post war production replacement mag that I purchased years ago. Also included is an original holster that is stamped in green ink BNZ 1944 & P35. Holster is made from medium brown leather and is in great condition as well. Original Nazi holsters like this fetch $200 and higher all the time on eBay. 

Finally there are (3) 16 round boxes of real Nazi WWII production 9mm ammo included. Ammo is packed in it's original UNOPENED boxes which are in unbelievably good condition for their 1944 production date. Boxes are stamped with manufacturer code ak 25. They also bear the letters mE. which means the bullets have iron cores. 

Bottom line is that this is one fine collection of WWII history all put together and ready to go, and it's sure to increase in value in the future. 

Asking $1000 for everything. Local sales only - no shipping. Buyer must be a Florida resident who is at least 21 years old and be able to legally own a firearm.

Thanks for looking.
